distributional 0.3.0
  • Reference
  • Changelog

Sampling distribution

Source: R/dist_sample.R
dist_sample.Rd

dist_sample(x)

Arguments

x

A list of sampled values.

Examples

# Univariate numeric samples
dist <- dist_sample(x = list(rnorm(100), rnorm(100, 10)))

dist
#> <distribution[2]>
#> [1] sample[100] sample[100]
mean(dist)
#> [1] 0.1029092 9.9701784
variance(dist)
#> [1] 1.0683928 0.8255002
skewness(dist)
#> [1]  0.07356551 -0.14233621
generate(dist, 10)
#> [[1]]
#>  [1] -0.5761974  0.5087168  0.4108233 -0.2774064 -0.9330726  0.5020513
#>  [7]  0.5020513 -0.1885503  0.8330368  0.4108233
#> 
#> [[2]]
#>  [1]  9.734050  8.409721  9.430151  9.877353  9.615429 11.217314 11.472677
#>  [8] 10.731127  9.281432 10.598713
#> 

density(dist, 1)
#> [1] 0.2213065 0.0000000

# Multivariate numeric samples
dist <- dist_sample(x = list(cbind(rnorm(100), rnorm(100, 10))))

dist
#> <distribution[1]>
#> [1] sample[100]
mean(dist)
#> [1] -0.04670374  9.95328017
variance(dist)
#>            [,1]       [,2]
#> [1,] 1.17019324 0.08378041
#> [2,] 0.08378041 1.24171349
skewness(dist)
#> [1] 0.004944234
generate(dist, 10)
#> [[1]]
#>              [,1]      [,2]
#>  [1,] -0.31692370  9.660146
#>  [2,]  0.80438551  9.130175
#>  [3,]  0.96417485  9.509686
#>  [4,]  0.96417485  9.509686
#>  [5,] -0.01405926 10.477200
#>  [6,] -0.79073132  9.750999
#>  [7,]  0.80438551  9.130175
#>  [8,] -0.79073132  9.750999
#>  [9,]  0.61894344  8.544260
#> [10,] -0.78586297  9.770079
#> 

density(dist, 1)
#> [1] 0.2156197 0.0000000
